basics.name: Stepanenko Anatolii
basics.label: Jr. Java Developer
basics.summary: Hi! My name is Stepanenko Anatolii. I’m a problem-driven, highly motivated, fast learning software developer with more, than 1 years of experience in Software Design and Development. I’m looking forward to an opportunity for working in a dynamic, challenging environment, where I can utilize my skills for developing my career and for the growth of the organization. Hands on experience Spring Frameworks (Core,JDBC, ORM, Web, CDI, AOP), Spring MVC. Hands on experience in Core Java, Java 8, JQuery, Spring Boot and ORM Hibernate. Hands on experience in TDD using JUnit, Mockito and MockMVC. Experience in working with databases such as Oracle RDBMS, CouchDB, PostgreSQL. Knowledge and understanding of OOP principles. Good Team player and also have ability to work independently. Adaptive to learn new technologies.

work.summary: This is my first position, related with Java Enterprise. I was impressed by the size and complexity of the system, which I had the opportunity to maintain and develop. Accepting the challenge, I plunged into work. For a short period I learned and then worked with the Java world technologies such as Spring Framework and is closely associated with it Spring MVC web framework. In the process of implementation of the new features, I had to face with the system's front-end. It was implemented using JQuery library and some other written before me, components. Architectural system was a classic three-galleries monolith. So of course I had to study the database. The project used the Oracle 11 DBMS. Quite often, I had to write queries to the database even though the fact, that the project was used Hibernate JPA provider. Also, data source selection has been designed quite unusual, but about it - on an interview ;-) (Note: All the above does not violate the NDA.) This post was interesting to me, not only from a technological point of view. Workflow required from me some communication skills, also the first time in my career, such as a multi-pronged communication (written communication, for example, in Jira, verbal at the weekly Skype meetings) on non-native English language for me.

work.company: Self employed. Direct contract with customer// does it right naming?
work.summary: The project aims to develop a system which provide to customer's visitors additional contextual information about exhibit such as additional text, archive images, photos and other multimedia materials through branded Android mobile app. Project results - successful implementation, a satisfied customer and thousands of satisfied users.
highlights: As project manager: Business meeting with the customer at all project stages, project planning, task management and time for their completion, project reporting to the customer, writing technical documentation and instructions.

As developer: Design of the system architecture, the choice of database (selected db is CouchDB - a document-oriented noSQL), the design of the document’s structure, writing a tests (JUnit), design and implementation of mobile (Android) application, design and implementation of content management desktop- application (Java, Swing) and writing installation scripts.

volunteer.summary: The project is aimed at creating in special libraries for the blind people tactile aids, printed on a 3D-printers. My role was in making exhibits, maintaining 3D printers in libraries, teaching the staff of library how to make exhibits on they own printers.

education.institution: Engineering and Technology Academy of Southern Federal University
education.area: CAD of electronics, PCB and IC

references.name: Senior Systems Analyst at Porto Seguro(via LinkedIn)
references.reference: Anatolii is a good professional. He seems to be always avaiable to help whatever is the subject.  He knows how to work and collaborate with the team.  He is also up to date with the new technologies.  One time I was developing a report solution and Anatolii helped me presenting some important suggestions regarding data security.
